thread.title: China's BIGGEST warship to plunge into battleground seas in rage against the US
thread.title_full: China's BIGGEST warship to plunge into battleground seas in rage against the US

title: China's BIGGEST warship to plunge into battleground seas in rage against the US

locations.name: south china sea  getty south china

text:
GETTY CHINA-US WAR: Donald Trump faces a tensions in the South China Sea 
War between China the US is now a “reality” Chinese military bosses said in a briefing last week from the People’s Liberation Army (PLA). 
Aircraft carrier the Shandong is now expected to be dispatched into the South China Sea as soon as construction of the massive vessel is finished. 
Beijing have been talking up total war with the US as the tensions with Washington look set to erupt in the Pacific Inside China's military An inside view of the Chinese military over 120 years. 1 / 25 “It will be used to tackle the complicated situations in the South China Sea” Chinese media 
China’s massive ship is the first home-built aircraft carrier and will be only the second in the superpower’s fleet. 
The vessel is expected to be completed in the first half of this year and is currently under construction in the port of Dalian. 
Chinese state media reported the Shandong will be positioned to deal with “complicated situations” in the South China Sea. 
GETTY WAR: Aircraft carrier the Liaoning led warships through the South China Sea 
GETTY SOUTH CHINA SEA: Aircraft take-off from the deck of the Liaoning 
Shandong is expected to be the biggest vessel in the Chinese fleet and will be armed with squadrons of fighter jets and naval bombers. 
Chinese military bosses boast the ship is “taking shape”– but have not given a date for completion for full details of armament. 
Warship the Liaoning – China’s first aircraft carrier – plunged through the disputed waters with a battle flotilla in tow as they tested weapons in the South China Sea. Royal Navy and RAF's most advanced equipment Monday, 21st December 2015 See the new aircraft carriers and submarine's have been built to combat war, check out the most advanced equipment the UK own. 1 / 7 PH A Joint Combat Aircraft streaks away from the aircraft carriers HMS Queen Elizabeth and HMS Prince of Wales, UK's new defence Related videos
